items.title: Score Mario Bros. Wonder at nearly 25% off before the Bellabel Park expansion lands this spring
items.summary:
Last year during Mario’s 40th anniversary celebration, Nintendo made a number of exciting announcements, many of which are set to land in 2026. But it is now a new year with a series of new releases on the horizon, including Mario Tennis Fever, Yoshi and the Mysterious Book, and the Super Mario Bros. Wonder – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Meetup in Bellabel Park. The expansion pack for this particularly fantastic 2D Mario experience set to land in spring 2026 so it might be a good idea to score a deal on the base game before then and Woot has the proper boxed U.S. version down at $46.99 Prime shipped right now – that’s nearly 25% off and the lowest price we can find. Learn more about the Meetup in Bellabel Park expansion right here. 

more…

items.summary: ALEPPO, Syria, Jan 7 - Fierce fighting resumed ‌in Syria's northern city of Aleppo between government forces and Kurdish fighters for a second day on ‌Wednesday, sending thousands of civilians fleeing and leaving at least four people dead.  Read full story

items.summary: Spotify is dropping the minimum episode requirement to three, minimum consumption hours to 2,000, and engaged audience member threshold to 1,000 over the last 30 days.

items.title: Soundproofing foam in Swiss bar fire should have been checked by law, official says

items.title: Don’t miss Samsung’s 32-inch QHD 180Hz gaming monitor while it’s 42% off at $250 low today
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Samsung’s 32-inch Odyssey G50D QHD 180Hz gaming monitor down to $249.99 shipped. This is regularly a $430 display, which is now seeing a straight-up $180 discount. Today’s deal – which is also matched at Best Buy – marks the return of the lowest price it hit during the Black Friday sale a couple of months back. It’s one of the more affordable QHD monitors in Samsung’s Odyssey lineup at the moment, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

items.title: Double your Switch 2’s storage before the prices go up with Samsung’s P9 Express microSD card for just $35
items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Samsung’s 256GB P9 Express microSD card down to $34.99 shipped. This Switch 2-compatible memory card typically goes for $55, so you’re looking at a straight-up 36% discount on it at the moment. It fell to $33 last month during the holiday sale, and today’s deal lands it within $2 of that all-time low price. The 512GB model has already climbed to $120 – about $20 more than its usual $100 price point – so you might want to jump in and snag the 256GB version while the deal is still live and is going for less than its launch price. Head below for more details.

items.title: A look at Kalshi and Polymarket's lucrative shift toward sports, as high-profile real-world bets raise questions about access, integrity, and US CFTC regulation (Bloomberg)

A look at Kalshi and Polymarket's lucrative shift toward sports, as high-profile real-world bets raise questions about access, integrity, and US CFTC regulation  —  Prediction platforms pitch themselves as tools for insight, but eye-catching bets on real-world events are raising questions about access, integrity and regulation.

items.title: Make up to 250 cuts with Greenworks’ 40V 18-inch high power cordless chainsaw kit at a new $255 low
items.summary:
Amazon is now offering the Greenworks 40V High Power 18-inch Cordless Chainsaw Kit with a 5.0Ah HP battery and 5A rapid charger at $255 shipped, which beats out the direct website pricing, where it is still being offered for its full $300 MSRP. This is a newer electric cutting solution from Greenworks that has been on the market since June, though we’ve seen very few discounts on it in the months since then. We’ve only spotted it going as low as $288, with the $45 markdown here taking things further than ever to a new all-time low price.

more…

items.title: Best of CES 2026: All of the weird, wild, and wonderful reveals from the biggest show in tech
items.summary:
CES 2026 – the biggest tech event of the year is now in full swing on the strip in Las Vegas with a countless number of new product reveals and wild new concepts. From desktop hologram machines and the new smart LEGO bricks, chargers that turn your phone into an AI robot assistant, the latest e-bikes, solar-powered gazebos, smart goggles, and the latest in electric vehicle tech, CES knows no bounds. We have collected all of the wildest and most intriguing reveals from the show from across our network for your browsing pleasure below.

items.title: Solve commuting needs while saving on storage space with MOD’s City 3 folding e-bikes at $1,799 lows
items.summary:
As part of MOD Bikes’ ongoing New Year Sale, which is continuing to offer rare price cuts of up to $400 across its e-bike lineup, you have a little more time left to hop on the City 3 Folding e-bike at $1,799 shipped, or its City+ Step-Thru 3 Folding e-bike at $1,799 shipped. These two variations of the brand’s folding commuter have spent much of the last year keeping to their $1,999 MSRPs, with discounts having only ever taken as much as $200 off at a time, whereas alternate models (mostly the SideCar e-bikes) have seen much larger discounts. There’s no telling when we’ll see another sale after this one ends, as the brand has been lessening them, so for the time that’s left, you can save $200 and get either at the best price we have tracked. You can also browse the full MOD New Year Sale lineup here.
